summary: This is an email chain from November 28, 2021, among U.S. Attorney's Office staff, regarding the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a motivational message from an Assistant U.S. Attorney, emphasizing the pursuit of justice for historical sex crimes and outlining logistical details for the trial's opening at the Southern District of New York courthouse.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

persons.name: Drescher, Sunny
persons.context: A recipient of the forwarded email about the Ghislaine Maxwell trial logistics and motivational message.

events.title: Opening of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The opening statements and preliminary instructions for the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell are scheduled to begin. The proceedings include peremptory challenges starting at 8:30 a.m.

locations: 40 Foley, courtroom 318 (Main courtroom, Southern District of New York)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Address of the Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The document is a pre-trial communication from the prosecution team expressing determination to prosecute Ghislaine Maxwell for historical sex crimes.
It asserts that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable children.
The trial is being held in the Southern District of New York, with the main courtroom at 40 Foley, courtroom 318.
The prosecution message frames the case as one where 'It is never too late for justice,' referencing crimes from as early as 1994.
The email outlines specific logistical details for trial observers, including overflow courtrooms and a conference room with a live feed.
